summary: This appears to be an internal email or note from the Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding Jeffrey Epstein's custody status, indicating he was being kept in a certain unit over the weekend and would likely be transferred to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) afterward. It also includes a personal note to Elissa.

persons.name: Elissa
persons.context: Addressed in the email, thanked for printing documents and for seeing Epstein, and asked about her mother.

persons.name: AW SS
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the author spoke with regarding the decision to keep Epstein in a certain custody status over the weekend.

events.title: Epstein Custody Status Decision
events.description: A decision was made to keep Jeffrey Epstein in a certain custody unit throughout the weekend, with a plan to transition him to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) after the weekend.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is dated July 25, 2019, shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
It outlines a plan for Epstein's custody: to be kept in a certain unit over the weekend and then likely moved to the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
The communication appears to be an internal email or note from the Federal Bureau of Prisons facility in New York.
The note includes a personal message to an employee named Elissa, thanking her for printing documents and for seeing Epstein.
